content: this legal case involves a family tomb and is currently being heard in the municipal court split the case has been ongoing for 11 months and the cost of the procedure is 10000 croatian kunas or 1327€ the final resolution of the case is that the family tomb which has six shelves and was built in 1989 will be divided the left side of the tomb belongs to the proposer d m k and the right side belongs to the proposed party m j k the proposed party is required to pay the proposer 10000 hrk within 15 days the decision is based on the property act and a previous court judgment the proposer attempted to register their right to the tomb with a company called n c k ltd but the company requested clarification on which grave sites belong to the proposer the proposed party repeatedly refused to divide the tomb leading the proposer to request the courts intervention the proposed party claims that they never refused to divide the tomb and argue that it is marital property they request the division of burial costs and debts owed by the proposer the proposed party also offered to buy the proposers half of the tomb but the proposer demanded unreasonably high amounts the proposed party requests that the court prevent the proposer from managing the tomb due to property irregularities a hearing was scheduled but the proposed party did not attend the deputy attorney for the proposer stated that the proposed party claimed the proposer owes compensation for expenses paid for the grave site the proposed party argued that they have the right to offset the cost of the tomb due to unpaid bills the judge decided that the right side of the tomb belongs to the proposed party and the left side belongs to the proposer the judge determined that a geometric division of the tomb is necessary
